str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
Acceptable, accepted. From dechomai; approved; propitious.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To listen to, hear favorably. From epi and akouo; to hearken to.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To come to the rescue of, come to help, help. From boethos; to aid or relieve.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.
From eu and a derivative of prosdechomai; well-received, i.e. Approved, favorable.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Feminine of a derivative of soter as noun; rescue or safety.
